definitions.definition: A large house or building, usually built for the wealthy.
A house provided for a clergyman; a manse.
A stopping-place during a journey; a stage.
An astrological house; a station of the moon.
One of twenty-eight sections of the sky.
(chiefly in the plural) An individual habitation or apartment within a large house or group of buildings. (Now chiefly in allusion to John 14:2.)
Any of the branches of the Rastafari movement.
